question: Who has become the first Egyptian footballer to win the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) Player of the Year for the 2017-18 season?
explanation: Mohamed Salah of Liverpool has become the first Egyptian player to be crowned the Professional Footballers\' Association (PFA) player of the year at the 45th PFA awards at Grosvenor House in central London on April 22, 2018. He is the first Liverpool player since Ian Rush to score 40 goals in a season, and has also matched Luis Suarez’s record of 31 Premier League goals in a campaign. He may yet break Rush’s goal record of 47 in a season. He currently has 41 goals in just 46 appearance in all competitions.
